item.title: Living across the river from Nyrstar zinc smelter has Jan doing what she can to lower lead risk
item.description: Jan Twomey bought a house on Hobart's eastern shore just over a year ago, knowing full well it was across from a zinc smelter. But news of high levels of lead detected in dust samples has her concerned.

item.title: OCD is often misunderstood. Elena wants you to know what it feels like
item.description: Elena wants people with OCD to know they're not alone. But how well do Australians understand the condition?

item.title: Matildas expected to name Mary Fowler in Asian Cup squad, injured Charli Grant set to miss out
item.description: Mary Fowler is expected to be named in Australia's Women's Asian Cup squad on Thursday despite having played limited minutes in her return from an ACL injury.

item.title: Telstra accused of environmental breaches in culturally-significant area in SA national park
item.description: Sources say the actions will likely affect Aboriginal communities and that the investigation was not shared with the public.

item.title: Test results show high levels of lead dust around Hobart
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Jürgen Klopp makes Milano Cortina Games cameo, ice hockey fight ban labelled a 'joke' — quick hits from day 11
item.description: Football manager Jürgen Klopp makes an appearance at the Milano Cortina Games, while French ice hockey players are unhappy about the ban handed to a teammate for fighting. Here are the quick hits from day 11.

item.title: Riverland wine grape growers want to rezone land for housing to exit industry
item.description: The wine grape industry in South Australia's Riverland continues to face unprecedented levels of uncertainty, as growers look to exit the industry and turn their land into residential housing.

item.title: Parkes Shire Council formally opposes controversial waste incinerator
item.description: The Parkes Shire Council has formally objected to controversial plans to dispose of some of Sydney's red-bin rubbish on the edge of its biggest town.

item.title: Iran announces temporary closure of Strait of Hormuz during US nuclear talks
item.description: Iran says it temporarily closed the Strait of Hormuz — a vital international shipping route — as it entered a new round of talks with the US over its nuclear capabilities.

item.title: Sydney Writers' Festival announces Randa Abdel-Fattah for 2026 program
item.description: Sydney Writers' Festival has defended featuring Randa Abdel-Fattah on its 2026 program, saying it is "not in the business of cancelling or censoring writers".

item.title: Pauline Hanson issues partial apology for suggesting there are no 'good' Muslims
item.description: The One Nation leader qualified her earlier remarks, which had been met with condemnation, while reiterating calls for tougher vetting processes for Muslim migrants.

item.title: Foo Fighters announce 2026 Australian stadium tour
item.description: American rock superstars Foo Fighters will return to Australia for a run of stadium shows before the year is out.

item.title: Real Madrid star Vinícius Júnior says Benfica's Gianluca Prestianni racially abused him in Champions League match
item.description: Real Madrid forward Vinícius Júnior accuses an opponent of racially abusing him during a Champions League game against Benfica, leading to the game being halted for nearly 10 minutes.

item.title: Australia's most successful Winter Olympics coach Peter McNiel and how his moguls team led the Milano Cortina gold rush
item.description: With a background in mathematics and an enviable attention to detail, it would be tempting to think of Australian ski coach Peter McNiel as moguls' answer to Moneyball. The truth is far more detailed.

item.title: Police release man arrested over Galiwin'ku stabbing death without charge
item.description: Police say a 19-year-old man arrested over the stabbing death of another man, 27, on Elcho Island on Saturday has been released without charge "pending further investigations".

item.title: Police charge man and woman with cocaine and cannabis offences at Airlie Beach
item.description: Two people have been charged after police allegedly found drugs, utensils and cash at an Airlie Beach property.

item.title: Housing to play part in future of both old and new ABC sites in Adelaide
item.description: The ABC's managing director says its current Adelaide bureau could be redeveloped in a similar way to an apartment building nearby, while the premier says affordable apartments will still be included on the new CBD site.

item.title: Police plea for public assistance to solve 1988 abduction and rape in St Kilda
item.description: A woman who was raped by two men in Melbourne's south-east in 1988 has spoken alongside police who are calling for public assistance to help solve the case.

item.title: As Donald Trump's first Board of Peace meeting approaches, Indonesians are watching their own president closely
item.description: Ahead of the inaugural meeting of US President Donald Trump's Board of Peace, charged with leading the way forward in Gaza, Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto faces perhaps his most significant foreign policy test yet.

item.title: Is it ever a good idea to stay together for the kids?
item.description: When a relationships breaks down, sometimes we think staying in the familiar discomfort is less scary — and even protective — for our kids. But is it ever a good idea to stay in an unhappy relationship for the sake of the children?

item.title: Equal time rule leads CBS to pull Stephen Colbert's James Talarico interview
item.description: The Late Show host's on-air revelation that network executives refused to let him interview a Democratic Senate candidate puts a spotlight on how US media outlets treat political coverage.

item.title: Legends slam Australia's 'not surprising' T20 World Cup crash out
item.description: For the first time since 2009, Australia won't advance from the group stage of a cricket World Cup and some of the game's greatest ever players are demanding answers.

item.title: Launceston Council scraps 4-day work week plan after backlash from business sector
item.description: A Tasmanian council's move to introduce a four-day work week, in part to attract and retain staff, has been abandoned after pushback by a business lobby group and what has been described as "unacceptable hostility" towards staff on social media.

item.title: James Slipper set to play 200th Super Rugby match as ACT Brumbies travel to face Crusaders in Christchurch
item.description: James Slipper will become the first Australian player to reach the 200-game milestone in Super Rugby.

item.title: Chalmers suggests ex-RBA governor's spending critique is due to personal vendetta
item.description: Treasurer Jim Chalmers says Philip Lowe was critical of the government over spending because it did not re-appoint him as RBA governor.

item.title: Mazda, Nissan, Hyundai and Subaru face multi-million-dollar penalties under NVES
item.description: Major car brands are staring down the barrel of multi-million-dollar penalties for exceeding their emissions, the first results of the federal government's climate laws for new vehicles have revealed.

item.title: Glove found near Nancy Guthrie's home fails to produce DNA match
item.description: The glove resembled a pair worn by an armed man in a ski mask seen in video footage shortly before she was abducted.

item.title: Planned nurse strike rescheduled at Lyell McEwin Hospital amid pay dispute
item.description: The South Australian government says plans from Lyell McEwin Hospital nurses to strike tomorrow have been postponed, amid an unresolved industrial dispute over pay and conditions.

item.title: Jesse Jackson helped lay the groundwork for Barack Obama and kept the fight for justice in the public eye
item.description: Reverend Jesse Jackson, who died on Tuesday aged 84, leaves behind a towering legacy in politics and the fight for justice in the United States and abroad.

item.title: Alcoa hit with record fine for unlawfully clearing WA jarrah forests for bauxite mine
item.description: US mining giant Alcoa is forced to pay $55 million after unlawfully clearing parts of a Western Australian native forest to mine bauxite.

item.title: Former Coles manager admits 'human error' over Shapes 'Down Down' pricing in federal court showdown
item.description: A former Coles manager has given evidence in the federal court on day three of a bombshell case between the consumer watchdog and supermarket giant.

item.title: Australian citizen with ISIS links in Syria hit with exclusion order, federal government says
item.description: The federal government has temporarily banned an Australian citizen linked to ISIS fighters from returning home from Syria.

item.title: Ex-Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila fined $11k over A-League card fixing saga
item.description: Former Macarthur FC captain Ulises Dávila avoids jail time over his involvement in a card fixing scandal.

item.title: Blue Bush Floodway enjoyed by all.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Wednesday finance with Alan Kohler
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 12
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Man fined $32,000 for poaching rare snakes from Far North Queensland rainforest
item.description: The court heard Clinton Spiteri was with two others when he visited a rainforest in the Cape York area to steal eight snakes.

item.title: More delays for Winter Olympics as 'severe' weather approaches
item.description: Milano Cortina organisers have been forced to postpone the men's aerials event, featuring Australian Reilly Flanagan, due to another forecast of inclement weather.

item.title: Driver charged over Camden fatal crash escaped Cumberland Hospital mental health care before incident
item.description: A driver charged over a double-fatal crash used a staff pass to escape hospital the day before an alleged Sydney stabber fled the same mental health facility.

item.title: Tackling 'blatant' fake discounting, restoring consumer trust among ACCC's priorities for 2026
item.description: ACCC chair Gina Cass-Gottlieb outlines the consumer watchdog's priorities for 2026, including targeting "blatant" fake discounting.

item.title: Danielle Scott wins silver medal in women's aerials event at 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics
item.description: Danielle Scott ends a 12-year drought for Australia by winning the silver medal in the women's aerials final at the Milano Cortina Winter Olympics.

item.title: Ukraine reclaims more than 200 square kilometres of territory as Elon Musk blocks Russian army's internet access
item.description: Ukraine has made its largest battlefield gains in more than two and a half years, retaking more than 200 square kilometres of its territory from Russia in just five days, according to a new analysis.

item.title: Antarctic pioneer John King Davis's grave was unmarked – until now
item.description: Captain John King Davis was one of Australia's greatest Antarctic explorers, but for decades, his final resting place was an unmarked grave in Melbourne. Today, that will change.

item.title: Tasmanian EPA drops plan to implement tighter lead controls after pushback from Nyrstar smelter
item.description: Three years ago, Tasmania's environment watchdog proposed to tighten lead emission limits from Hobart's zinc smelter to bring the state into line with national standards — but after pushback from the operator, that plan was dropped.

item.title: Mary Fowler named in Matildas Women's Asian Cup squad, Sam Kerr to captain
item.description: Considered the Matildas' X-factor, Mary Fowler has been named in the Women's Asian Cup squad, just 10 months after sustaining an ACL injury.

item.title: Today in History, February 19: Britpop, beats and a lust for life on Trainspotting's deathless soundtrack
item.description: Most films are lucky to get just one needle-drop moment embedded in the Zeitgeist. Trainspotting boasted several.

item.title: Quiz: Which books are these literary quotes from?
item.description: Are you happiest with your nose in a book? Did you spend summer reading at the beach? This quiz is for you.

item.title: Government spending is creeping up and threatening Australia’s 'low-debt' status
item.description: Australia will cease to be a low-debt country and be more vulnerable in a future crisis without a combination of spending restraint and tax reform, a new report has warned.

item.title: Senate committee features climate disinformation, the Atlas Network, and Dr Karl's clash with One Nation
item.description: The scourge of AI-slopaganda, viral disinformation campaigns and online attacks against individuals and institutions is going to get far worse before it gets better, if the latest public hearings on the topic are any indication.

item.title: Trump official says US did not censor Colbert interview but is probing The View
item.description: The confirmation of a probe into the daytime talk show came after it interviewed the same Democratic candidate whose interview with Stephen Colbert was allegedly barred from airing.

item.title: Perth couple Jonathan and Amy Carr-Knox locked in international surrogacy battle to bring home daughter
item.description: Jonathan and Amy had a child via surrogacy in Argentina. They have been stuck there for 12 months, unable to bring their daughter home.

item.title: Danielle Scott's Winter Olympic silver ends years of pain
item.description: In this most tension-filled Winter Olympic sport, it's no wonder tears are a by-product of both success and failure. Thankfully for Dani Scott, this time she was crying tears of pure joy.

item.title: Renewable energy company abandons native title court application over Darwin solar farm
item.description: A renewable energy company planning to build a solar farm near Darwin withdraws a court application that traditional owners argued would "erase" their rights.

item.title: Could SA Liberal leader Ashton Hurn lose her seat at the next election?
item.description: It's an almost unthinkable scenario, but the fact it's even being discussed shows the extent of the Liberal Party's predicament.

item.title: No plans to ban more phrases under hate speech laws, Queensland premier says
item.description: Religious groups and unions have expressed their concern about a Queensland government move to ban the use of certain phrases as part of an antisemitism crackdown.

item.title: Advocates call for more accessible cool spaces for people with heat regulation impairments
item.description: With heatwave events set to be more frequent across the country, researchers say thermoregulation must be part of urban planning to avoid risking the lives of people with heat regulation impairments.

item.title: Cherbourg turns to emerging technology while it waits for $26m water treatment plant
item.description: Just three hours from Brisbane, the residents of Cherbourg need to boil the town water to make it safe to drink. Delays to a new water treatment plant have driven them to use emerging technology that creates clean water from thin air.

item.title: Fiji's former prime minister Frank Bainimarama charged with inciting mutiny
item.description: Long-serving Fiji prime minister Frank Bainimarama and a former police commissioner will face court on Tuesday on charges of mutiny.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Dog invades cross-country skiing, Americans get engaged as Ally Hickman feels the pain — day 12 quick hits
item.description: A pair of US athletes announce their engagement as Ally Hickman's medal bid turns sour and a dog steals the show at the cross-country skiing. Here are the quick hits from day 12 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Outback families hope for change amid review into Queensland Patient Travel Subsidy Scheme
item.description: The cost of living is hurting outback residents who need to travel for medical treatment. They say government subsidies need to increase as the price of everything continues to rise.

item.title: James and Sophie among West Australians keen to give back as regional doctors
item.description: After graduating six years apart at the same high school in Kalgoorlie, both James Gent and Sophie Barton are following their dream of becoming a doctor.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: Channel Nine reporter Danika Mason apologises after viral Today show cross
item.description: Danika Mason has apologised for letting her standards slip during a live cross to the Today show from the Winter Olympics in Milano Cortina.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg tells court Meta no longer designs apps to maximise screen time
item.description: The Meta chief executive's comments were made in a landmark trial over youth social media addiction.

item.title: Home and businesses raided as Darwin NDIA employee arrested for alleged $5m NDIS fraud
item.description: A 47-year-old Darwin public servant has been arrested and charged for allegedly defrauding $5 million from the National Disability Insurance Scheme.

item.title: Midwest farmers want Defence action on explosive risk after fire at Depot Hill wildflower reserve
item.description: Residents are calling for clarity and action over the risk of unexploded WWII ordnance after a popular wildflower reserve was torched in WA's Midwest.

item.title: From crime heists to a BDSM love story, here's what's in cinemas this month
item.description: Australians will also finally be able to catch Sirât and The Voice of Hind Rajab, two movies that will be vying for Best International Film at the Academy Awards next month.

item.title: Brisbane's Lang Park concert cap almost doubles under new trial
item.description: A one-year trial will see the number of concerts at Brisbane's Lang Park almost double from 12 to 21 per year.

item.title: How exclusion orders could ban Australian citizens from returning home indefinitely
item.description: One of the Australian women being held in a Syrian refugee camp has been barred from returning home after being given a temporary exclusion order — but the ban may not be as temporary as the name implies.

item.title: Lakemba Mosque calls for more security after third threatening letter as Ramadan begins
item.description: Another threatening letter has been sent to Lakemba Mosque in Sydney's west, the third in recent weeks just hours before the start of Ramadan on Wednesday.

item.title: SA secures Australian MotoGP, world-first street circuit announced
item.description: The South Australian government has confirmed the Australian MotoGP will move to Adelaide from 2027, bringing with it huge economic benefits, but the opposition and Greens say the state has other priorities.

item.title: The Kyneton women's football team's story was always about more than just one club
item.description: The women's team from Kyneton's 15-month public and bitter saga suggests it is the canary in the coal mine of a widespread issue for women's players across the country.

item.title: Unemployment rate remains at 4.1pc in January, leading to talk of another rate rise
item.description: Australia's unemployment rate remained at 4.1 per cent in January, with 17,800 more employed people.

item.title: Feed and water supplies dry up in NSW as drought tightens grip
item.description: Over this season's hot and dry summer in New South Wales, farmer Ryan Staniforth has spent much of his time carting water to keep his sheep alive.

item.title: BlueScope remains in race for Whyalla steelworks as analyst warns of market concentration
item.description: Twelve months since the Whyalla steelworks was forced into administration, the sale process has entered its final stages, with the number of interested buyers narrowing from a field of 70 to five. One of those already owns Australia's largest steelworks in Port Kembla.

item.title: Charlie Pickering on his ADHD, satire and the 'ludicrous' Trump era
item.description: Political satire occasionally comes at a price, but Charlie Pickering still believes the right joke at the right time can have a huge impact.

item.title: The heartwarming tribute to injured aerials star Laura Peel at the Winter Olympics
item.description: This Winter Olympics aerials competition saw plenty of Aussies achieve lifetime goals, but they never forgot the one person who was missing — injured champion Laura Peel.

item.title: Wayne Gardner disappointed Victoria won't host Australian MotoGP
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Labor opposition propose five-day kindergarten for Tasmania
item.description: Tasmania's state opposition unveils a policy to extend kindergarten to five days a week in an effort to tackle the state's underperforming education system, but the government says Labor is "light on details".

item.title: Premier Chris Minns questions what went wrong amid Cumberland Hospital patient escapes
item.description: NSW Premier Chris Minns says it is "deeply distressing" that two mental health patients who escaped from the same Sydney hospital within 24 hours went on to allegedly kill three people between them.

item.title: Alcoa's environmental record 'disappointing' says WA premier after $55m payment for unlawful jarrah forest clearing
item.description: Roger Cook criticises Alcoa's environmental record for being "not at the level we expect", after the US mining giant agreed to pay $55 million for clearing a native jarrah forest in WA's south without approval.

item.title: Adelaide Ice Arena charged after patrons hospitalised for alleged carbon monoxide exposure
item.description: Safework SA has launched criminal proceedings against the Adelaide Ice Arena, after hockey players and spectators were allegedly exposed to "significant levels" of carbon monoxide more than two years ago, leading to more than 40 hospitalisations.

item.title: Heavy rain through north Queensland leads to multiple floodwater rescues and Bruce Highway closures
item.description: Heavy rainfall across north Queensland has led to multiple rescues and the closure of several sections of the Bruce Highway.

item.title: Sydney businessman compiled reports for what he allegedly believed was Chinese intelligence, court hears
item.description: A LinkedIn introduction led to Australian businessman Alexander Csergo compiling reports for two people he believed worked for a Chinese intelligence agency in exchange for cash, a jury has heard.

item.title: In her memoir, Gisèle Pelicot reveals the secret love behind France's most infamous rape trial
item.description: The world knows Gisèle Pelicot as the woman who waived anonymity during France's most infamous rape trial. But in her new memoir she reveals an unexpected story — the boyfriend she kept hidden and the love that helped her face an open courtroom.

item.title: North Qld Anglican diocese given green light to sell properties to pay compensation
item.description: A successful Supreme Court application will allow the church to sell assets to help fund its commitments to victims of historical child abuse.

item.title: Rugby fans furious over 2027 Rugby World Cup ticket website crashes
item.description: Rugby fans from around the world are furious after failing to get tickets to the 2027 Men's World Cup due technical glitches and website crashes.

item.title: For salty South Australians, motorsport revenge is oh so sweet
item.description: The last Grand Prix in Adelaide was held in 1995 before its move across the border to Victoria. Now, Adelaide has poached the MotoGP — but will it be enough to appease resentful SA Formula One fans?

item.title: Free RSV flu vaccine for aged care residents to be rolled out in WA
item.description: After a horror flu season last year, free RSV vaccinations are being rolled out for the first time for older Western Australians living in residential aged care.

item.title: Canberra schoolboys face drug-affected driver who struck them outside St Edmund's College
item.description: Tayler Hazell is facing his victims in a sentencing hearing in the ACT Supreme Court. He struck two students in Canberra in a stolen car while high on drugs.

item.title: Hanson digs her heels in, Taylor goes on tour
item.description: This week, the new opposition leader revealed his shadow cabinet while Pauline Hanson spun through a cycle she knows well.

item.title: Vegetable scraps to be turned into bioenergy by Scenic Rim farm as part of $291 million project
item.description: A new $291 million project set to turn farm scraps to energy has begun construction in Queensland's Scenic Rim.

item.title: What is Skimo? The sport preparing to steal the show at the Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Skimo, or ski mountaineering, is coming to the 2026 Winter Olympics. But what is the sport and why is it so exciting?

item.title: Court hears statement murdered woman Irma Palasics made after harrowing assault a year earlier
item.description: A statement made by murdered woman Irma Palasics after a burglary at her home a year prior is read to the ACT Supreme Court.

item.title: Racing NSW disqualifies stablehand and owner Brian Carey over racehorse death in Maryborough
item.description: Registered owner and stablehand Brian Carey is disqualified after being found guilty by Racing NSW of failing to ensure his racehorse, City Limits, had sufficient food and water.

item.title: Salmon farm antibiotics found in native Tasmanian species kilometres away
item.description: An antibiotic used by the Tasmanian salmon farming industry is detected in native species more than 10km away from the closest fish operation using it.

item.title: Man accused of 'controlling' the lives of Venezuelan youth group granted bail
item.description: An alleged religious leader accused of "controlling every aspect" of the lives of a Venezuelan youth group has been granted release on strict home detention conditions by a South Australian court.

item.title: SA Premier Peter Malinauskas criticised over aged care workforce comments
item.description: South Australia's Premier Peter Malinauskas has been criticised across the political divide for comments he made asking One Nation voters "who's going to feed you and bathe you and wipe your bum when you're 90", but a government spokesperson says the comments have been mischaracterised.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on Day 13
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Collingwood apologises after asking elderly members for donations via their wills
item.description: The Magpies have come under fire after a letter campaign asking elderly members to amend their wills to donate to the AFL club.

item.title: Coles manager moved product onto 'Down Down' promotion days after price hike to be more competitive
item.description: A second Coles manager has been grilled in the federal court over whether rushing a product onto a "Down Down" promotion could have broken internal guidelines.

item.title: South Korea's ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol sentenced to life in prison over insurrection
item.description: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol is sentenced to life in prison on charges of rebellion for his attempt to put the country under military rule.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim organisers weigh cancellation as 55 kph winds forecast
item.description: As thousands of people prepare to tackle Western Australia's iconic Rottnest Island Swim, rough weather is threatening to grind it to a halt just 48 hours before it begins.

item.title: Gas explosion kills 16 after apartment building partially collapses in southern Pakistan
item.description: Women and children are among 16 people killed after a gas explosion ripped through an apartment building in Pakistan on Thursday.

item.title: Greg Lynn applies for bail as retrial for High Country camper murder looms
item.description: The former Jetstar pilot awaits a retrial for the murder of Carol Clay, after his 2024 conviction was quashed in December.

item.title: American star completes comeback with figure skating gold after 'retiring' at 16
item.description: Alysa Liu becomes the first American woman to win singles figure skating gold in 24 years, completing her comeback after retiring in 2022 when she was only 16 years old.

item.title: Employees of Albany lolly shop fined for illegal tobacco sales say they were never paid
item.description: "Vulnerable" staff at a smoke shop disguised as a candy store in Albany say they were never paid by the shop's mystery operators.

item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Have Australian researchers found the secret to treating sepsis?
item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.description: Sarah Ferguson presents Australia's premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting public affairs journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus political analysis from Laura Tingle.

item.title: Michael Brian Becton sentenced to more than 24 years in jail for child sex offences
item.description: Michael Brian Becton, 33, is handed a 24-and-a-half year prison term after pleading guilty to 77 child sexual offences against children and babies. WARNING: This story contains details that some readers may find distressing.

item.title: Former prince returns home as police investigation continues — as it happened
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has returned to his Sandringham home after being arrested and questioned on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

item.title: What we know about ex-prince Andrew's arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office
item.description: Police are searching two addresses in the UK, including Royal Lodge on the Windsor Estate where the former prince lived until last year.

item.title: Ally Hickman showed her grit at 2026 Winter Olympics after heavy fall on second run
item.description: In a Winter Olympics beset by both glory and injury, Ally Hickman's heavy fall in the snowboard slopestyle could have turned a happy day into another disappointing one. Instead, the young Aussie showed her grit to get back up and go again.

item.title: Donald Trump suggests decision on Iran likely within 10 to 15 days
item.description: Speaking at the inaugural "Board of Peace" meeting in Washington DC, the US president warns "bad things" will happen if a "meaningful deal" isn't reached in nuclear talks with Iran.

item.title: Former premier joins community calls for speed reduction at 'dangerous' fatal intersection in Newham
item.description: A community in central Victoria is calling for a 20 kph speed limit reduction at a "terribly dangerous" intersection after four major accidents.

item.title: Sisters Lisa and Rachael Maza reunite on stage for the world premiere of Black Light
item.description: The former head of Indigenous theatre company Ilbijerri teams up with her sister Lisa for the world premiere of Black Light, which tells the story of three generations of Blak women.

item.title: Weekly news quiz: Museum robberies, the Lunar New Year and a new shadow cabinet
item.description: It has been a huge week in news. Did you catch these stories?

item.title: Man On The Run: How Paul McCartney rebuilt his life after The Beatles
item.description: Morgan Neville's new documentary is a fascinating portrait of an artist rebuilding himself while the world watches on.

item.title: Calls for protection of Tasmania's penguins amid reports of birds 'handled by the neck'
item.description: Each summer, tourists flock to Tasmanian beaches to marvel at penguins, but for some, admiring the birds from afar is not enough.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Georgia Voll top scores as Australia beats India in second Twenty20 by 19 runs
item.description: The retirement of Alyssa Healy leaves a big hole at the top of the order, but Georgia Voll looks capable of stepping in after a career-best outing in Canberra.

item.title: As electric car prices fall, will affordability win over drivers?
item.description: The price tag of EVs has been a barrier to uptake. As cheaper models hit the market, will more drivers go electric?

item.title: The 2026 South Australia election is here — Have your say about what matters to you
item.description: We want to know what issues matter most to you and what you want us to find out ahead of the March 21, SA election.

item.title: Full list of 11 Australian women with ISIS links trying to leave Syria revealed
item.description: The ABC can reveal the names of the 11 women connected to former Islamic State fighters in Syria who attempted to journey home to Australia this week.

item.title: Voters divided as Barnaby Joyce considers contesting New England for One Nation
item.description: One Nation MP Barnaby Joyce says he might recontest his seat of New England as a candidate for One Nation if the party needs him to.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's arrest could end monarchy's 'never complain, never explain' mentality
item.description: British royals have lived by the adage "never complain, never explain", but these days, many of their subjects are demanding answers.

item.title: Youth justice experts warn over-policing of residential care children is 'manufacturing criminals'
item.description: Experts say over-policing and South Australia's youth criminal justice system is helping turn children in residential care into criminals.

item.title: Study to test whether a new helmet will significantly reduce risk of concussion in football players
item.description: A lot of research has gone in to treating concussions, but now scientists are testing a new helmet to see if it can prevent them before they happen.

item.title: Can Angus Taylor get beyond slogans to craft a sound immigration policy?
item.description: The rifts in Australia's social cohesion can be seen in the blow-up over the so-called ISIS brides and their children, who want to come to Australia.

item.title: Wild horse art on birth certificates is 'hypocritical', says brumby welfare group
item.description: A limited-edition birth certificate released to mark the Chinese Year of the Horse is being labelled "hypocritical" as a cull of wild horses continues in the NSW high country.

item.title: Amyl and the Sniffers singer in escalating legal battle with photographer
item.description: What began as a photo shoot with champagne, ice cream and humorous glamour shots of Amy Taylor, singer from punk band Amyl and the Sniffers, has escalated into a legal fight over copyright, the US Constitution and an application for a restraining order.

item.title: Coalition willing to help stop passports for IS-linked women— as it happened
item.description: Angus Taylor says the Coalition is willing to help the government strengthen legislation so women with ties to Islamic State are not issued Australian passports.

item.title: More rainfall expected for parts of northern Queensland after wet week
item.description: A risk for further heavy rainfall and thunderstorms is possible in northern parts of the state today and into the weekend.

item.title: First NT women's prison opens in Alice Springs with focus on rehabilitation to break 'cycle of reoffending'
item.description: Thirty-five female prisoners have moved into the Northern Territory's first women's prison, near Alice Springs, with more expected in the coming months.

item.title: Major US fund's credit squeeze could 'blow up' — as it happened
item.description: Shares in US asset manager Blue Owl have fallen sharply after it announced it was having challenges meeting investors' cash demands.

item.title: Donald Trump says Andrew's arrest is a 'shame' for Royal family
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sam Altman and Dario Amodei refuse to hold hands
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bill Gates pulls out of India AI summit amid Epstein files scrutiny
item.description: Microsoft co-founder Bill Gates pulls out of his keynote address at India's AI Impact Summit hours before it was scheduled to take place.

item.title: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor released under investigation after almost 10 hours in custody
item.description: The former Duke of York has been released under investigation by British police, as officers continue to search his former Windsor home.

item.title: Bangarra Dance Theatre wins Golden Lion at international dance festival Venice Danza 2026
item.description: Indigenous dance company Bangarra Dance Theatre has become the first company and first First Nations performers to receive the Golden Lion at Venice Danza, the international festival of contemporary dance.

item.title: 'Dying' NASA satellite leaves Australia's north waiting hours for latest fire information
item.description: A NASA satellite used to detect bushfires in real time across two thirds of Australia is "dying" and it could be months before a replacement is online.

item.title: Donald Trump hosts first 'Board of Peace' meeting with new pledges for Gaza
item.description: A group of nations will provide billions of dollars and thousands of troops to rebuild Gaza, according to pledges made at the inaugural meeting of Donald Trump's "Board of Peace".

item.title: Canadian skier Cassie Sharpe's horrific crash in the halfpipe reminds us of Winter Olympics dangers
item.description: As Cassie Sharpe lay motionless on the base of the Livigno halfpipe, the excruciating tension reminded us all that winter Olympians are only ever seconds from disaster.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026: JD Vance laments Eileen Gu's choice and Scotty James channels Wolf of Wall Street — day 13 quick hits
item.description: Scotty James says he is not done, while Sweden claims the entire curling world is "against us". Here are the quick hits from day 13 at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu set to show world leaders climate change impact ahead of COP31
item.description: Fiji, Palau and Tuvalu look set to host world leaders and climate change ministers in the lead-up to COP31 in a bid to encourage larger countries to accelerate cuts to emissions.

item.title: Is it OK to feed Australia's wild birds?
item.description: Many of us love interacting with and feeding wild birds, but experts say giving them the wrong types of food can do more harm than good.

item.title: NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby's sentence extended on appeal, as victim's family say they feel 'broken'
item.description: The sentence of NT hit-and-run driver Jake Danby has been extended on appeal, meaning he will serve two years in home detention. Danby hit two pedestrians with his car in June 2024, killing one.

item.title: Australian exporters could face windfall if Trump tariffs ruled unlawful by US Supreme Court
item.description: Modelling by consulting firm EY Australia shows Australian exporters would be owed more than $1.4 billion in refunds collectively if the US tariffs are struck down.

item.title: NT cattle sector backs draft buffel grass plan as environmental and Aboriginal groups say it favours industry
item.description: Cattle producers support the NT's draft buffel grass weed management plan, but it has attracted criticism from traditional owners and environmental groups.

item.title: Brisbane Broncos lose World Club Challenge to Hull KR 30-24
item.description: After pulling off three straight comebacks to win the NRL premiership, the Brisbane Broncos fall just short of another miracle against Hull KR in the World Club Challenge.

item.title: Indra Brown's Winter Olympics medal contention doesn't remove the reality of school homework
item.description: Sixteen-year-old Indra Brown came into the Winter Olympics as one of the top medal contenders in freeski halfpipe — a status elevated since she finished fourth in qualification — but it still doesn't get her out of maths homework.

item.title: David James Pye found guilty of murdering former Rebels boss Nick Martin after recruiting sniper
item.description: Bikie David Pye is convicted of murder after he paid a trained sniper to assassinate his former friend and ex-Rebels boss Nick Martin in front of horrified onlookers at a drag racing event.

item.title: Commercial fishing licence buybacks recommended in latest harmful algal bloom report
item.description: Fishing licence buybacks and long-term restocking plans are some of the recommendations in the latest report into South Australia's harmful algal bloom, which has been labelled as "vanilla" by one scientist turned political candidate.

item.title: Timeline of key moments leading to former prince Andrew's arrest
item.description: Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor has for years faced allegations over his contact with Jeffrey Epstein. These key moments led to his arrest on suspicion of misconduct in public office.

item.title: Eric Dane, star of Grey's Anatomy and Euphoria, dies aged 53
item.description: The star was best known for his role as Dr Mark Sloan in long-running medical drama Grey's Anatomy, and as the patriarch of the Jacobs family in teen hit Euphoria.

item.title: WA councils could make laws to stop cats roaming under proposed state legislation
item.description: The WA government announces plans to give local councils the power to require cats to be contained to owners' properties, to protect native birds and other wildlife.

item.title: The Board of Peace meant to rebuild Gaza may well end up as another monument to Donald Trump
item.description: Unless the Board of Peace begins to focus and genuinely tries to make the world a better place, this may well prove to be yet another monument to Donald Trump.

item.title: Cameron William Leslie Clark, accused of Easts Leagues Club stabbing, appears in court
item.description: Cameron William Leslie Clark is accused of repeatedly stabbing a 20-year-old female employee of the Easts Leagues Club in Coorparoo last Thursday night.

item.title: Complainant in former Liberal MP Rory Amon's underage sexual assault trial addresses court
item.description: The complainant in the sexual assault trial of former Liberal MP Rory Amon has told a court of the alleged incidents that took place in a car park toilet when he was 13.

item.title: Eileen Gu says JD Vance is 'sweet' for saying she should be competing for US at 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: Eileen Gu says she is flattered that JD Vance thinks she should be competing for the US, but feels his comments are driven by an anti-China bias from Washington.

item.title: Racist hate mail sent to politicians bears hallmarks of Lakemba Mosque letters
item.description: The ABC can reveal two of the threatening, hate-filled letters sent to Lakemba Mosque this month bear close resemblance to similar racist letters sent to multiple politicians since 2022.

item.title: What to watch, read and listen to this weekend: Eternity, "Wuthering Heights" and new Meg Mac
item.description: From a cursed vagina to a classic retold, there's plenty of culture to dig into this weekend.

item.title: Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage charged with illegal surveillance by WA Police sex crime division
item.description: Geraldton Senior Constable Stuart Parsonage has been charged with the illegal installation of a surveillance device and unlawful use of a computer by WA sex crime detectives.

item.title: Parents speak at sentencing hearing for Christopher Turner over fatal gas mix-up
item.description: The parents of two babies given nitrous oxide in a fatal gas mix-up at a Sydney hospital almost a decade ago express their pain and trauma at the sentencing hearing for the man responsible.

item.title: Mercedes F1 boss Toto Wolff defends team over engine drama ahead of Australian Grand Prix
item.description: Toto Wolff accuses rival Formula 1 manufacturers of ganging up on Mercedes to pressure the governing FIA to change engine rules, but says it will make no difference.

item.title: Coroner delivers findings into James Tsindos's death from allergic reaction to delivery meal
item.description: A Victorian coroner hands down her findings into the death of a teenager who suffered a severe allergic reaction to a delivery meal — but it's unclear if more urgent treatment would have saved his life.

item.title: Kyra Wheatley ready to ride the chaos and speed of ski cross at Milano Cortina 2026 Winter Olympics
item.description: The speed and chaos of ski cross is what attracted Kyra Wheatley to the sport, and to realise a dream 12 years in the making of competing at the Winter Olympics.

item.title: Scientists model best-case and worst-case climate scenarios for Antarctica
item.description: Scientists say parts of Antarctica face "devastating" and "irreversible" impacts from climate change unless urgent action is taken to limit greenhouse gas emissions.

item.title: MotoGP Adelaide move raises concerns about rider safety, transport and trees
item.description: A rider, a reporter and a road safety expert say it will be difficult to make it safe for motorcycles to race around the Adelaide Parklands.

item.title: How Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor's 10 hours in police custody unfolded
item.description: Ostracised by his family and stripped of his titles, Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor celebrates his 66th birthday with police.

item.title: WA treasury takes rates from forestry plantations, leaving regional WA shires with funding shortfall
item.description: Seven South West councils face $325,000 funding shortfall after forestry rate payments redirected to state Treasury. Shires warn residents could face higher rates or cuts to essential services as they push the state government for a solution.

item.title: Woman who fatally struck 12-year-old Marshall Oakley-Stagg granted restricted driver's licence
item.description: A driver who struck and killed a 12-year-old boy outside his school in southern Tasmania in 2024 has been granted a restricted licence.

item.title: Winter Olympics 2026 quick guide: What to watch on day 14
item.description: Find out what's on at the Winter Olympics in Milan.

item.title: Port Pirie's toddlers record highest blood lead levels in a decade
item.description: The percentage of two-year-old children above the blood lead level threshold in Port Pirie is the highest in a decade, according to the latest figures.

item.title: Glider pilot creates aviation history in Central Australia flying 1,266 kilometres
item.description: A Queensland pilot has made aviation history in Central Australia, flying more than 1,200 kilometres without an engine in a record-breaking glider flight launched from Alice Springs.

item.title: Ellyse Perry's evolution cements greatness as Australian cricket milestone looms
item.description: Cricket superstar Ellyse Perry will become the first woman to play 350 matches for Australia across all formats on Saturday.

item.title: Man accused of performing Nazi salute at AFL exploring mental health defence
item.description: Tylere Baker-Pearce, 39, was initially charged with giving the salute at the Gabba, and was later hit with two additional counts of the alleged offence.

item.title: Nurses' strike at Adelaide's Lyell McEwin Hospital cancelled after pay increase ahead of state election start
item.description: The Australian Nursing and Midwifery Federation cancels a strike at one of Adelaide's largest public hospitals after securing a 2 per cent pay rise on top of a 4 per cent immediate increase in wages announced earlier this week.

item.title: Queensland's new chief health officer Marianne Gale outlines future priorities
item.description: Marianne Gale reminisces about her time working for Doctors Without Borders to emphasise how she wants to shape the public health of the state – with a strong focus on equity.

item.title: Newcastle man avoids jail for child abuse images and bestiality videos
item.description: A man has avoided time behind bars and instead been handed a three-year community corrections order for possessing 34,000 child abuse images and more than a dozen bestiality videos.

item.title: Cockroaches peer out of a communications access hole in Adelaide
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Cockroach numbers surge in Adelaide during warm, humid weather
item.description: Adelaide residents have been reporting increased numbers of unwelcome six-legged visitors in their homes, but with humid weather to continue amid a flood warning for the state's north, they are likely to stick around for a while yet.

item.title: Firefighters used aerial assets on Friday to douse a fire burning near Gaffneys Creek.
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Bushfire at Gaffneys Creek in central-east Victoria burning out of control
item.description: Residents in a remote Victorian community have been urged to evacuate as an out-of-control fire rages nearby.

item.title: Licence for use of antibiotic florfenicol in Tasmanian salmon industry may be suspended
item.description: The federal agency that approved the use of an antibiotic for Tasmania's salmon industry has proposed to suspend that licence, in the wake of news the antibiotic has been found in native species.

item.title: Friday Finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: SA state election polls could lead to one or no seats for Liberal Party, analyst says
item.description: Two opinion polls show fewer South Australians intend to vote for the Liberal Party than One Nation ahead of the official state election campaign period.

item.title: New Zealand man Tamaohungia Joseph Tepatu-Edwards jailed for 26 years for attempted cocaine importation
item.description: A man who tried to smuggle more than 800 kilograms of cocaine into WA – and was only caught when his boat broke down — will spend two decades in jail and is "likely" be deported.

item.title: Rottnest Channel Swim cancelled due to strong winds, choppy seas
item.description: Perth's iconic Rottnest Channel Swim has been cancelled as forecast strong winds and unfavourable ocean conditions leaves thousands of swimmers and support crew disappointed.

item.title: Police receive 'reports of crime' in relation to Pauline Hanson interview
item.description: One Nation senator Pauline Hanson accuses the government of trying to put her "back in jail", after police received reports of a crime in relation to the senator's inflammatory comments about Muslims during a media interview.

item.title: Live: Walker returns in two-woman bobsleigh as Aussies contest heats
item.description: Australia has two teams competing in the heats of the two-woman bobsleigh at the Milano Cortina Olympics. Follow live.

item.title: Trump wants federal agencies to release files on UFOs and extraterrestrials
item.description: US President Donald Trump says he will direct federal agencies to begin "identifying and releasing" government files related to UFOs and aliens.

item.title: Dolphins defeat New Zealand Warriors in NRL trial, Jackson Ford sin-bin for hip-drop tackle
item.description: The New Zealand Warriors' hopes of having no-nonsense forward Jackson Ford on deck for their season opener are in the hands of the NRL's match review committee after he was sin-binned in a 38-34 trial loss to the Dolphins.

item.title: NSW Waratahs defeat Fijian Drua in Super Rugby Pacific round two, Pete Samu plays after birth of child
item.description: Wallabies veteran Pete Samu has helped the NSW Waratahs to consecutive wins to start the Super Rugby Pacific season, just hours after the birth of his child.

item.title: Australia blows Oman away to end T20 World Cup campaign with a bang
item.description: Australia has flogged Oman, chasing down 105 in less than 10 overs to end a disappointing World Cup campaign on a high. Follow live.

item.title: Man whose girlfriend froze to death after he left her mountain convicted of manslaughter
item.description: A man who left his girlfriend to freeze to death on an Austrian mountain has been handed a five-month suspended sentence for manslaughter.

item.title: Jeffrey Epstein's estate agrees to pay up to $US35 million to settle class action
item.description: Jeffrey Epstein's estate has agreed to pay as much as $US35 million to resolve a class action lawsuit, according to a court filing on Thursday.

item.title: US Supreme Court rules Trump tariffs are illegal
item.description: The US Supreme Court hands down a bombshell ruling against President Donald Trump's tariffs.

item.title: Royal protection police close to Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor to be grilled
item.description: British police officers involved in royal protection are set to be grilled as part of a review into Andrew Mountbatten-Windsor, as authorities probe information on "anything they saw or heard".
